page.title: 10THE FARMERS YEAR CONT.
page.content: the sheep on grain and animal cake etc. In{April}the young sheep are dipped, dosed and their horns are {branded}with an{"S"}which stands for {Stewart.}When the lambing is underway the shepherds are very busy, because the ewes have to be inspected every day.Some of the ewes have their lambs on the hill,the ones that don't, are taken to{Auchlany}Greens.A fortnight later the ewes which haven't yet lambed are taken down to{Struan. All the lambs are dipped given medicine, and their ears are marked by cutting off a bit. The lambs are dipped because they have ticks on them and the ticks suck the lambs blood.A tick doesn't do them much harm, but it spreads diseases like
